alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 8:24AM PST until December 07 at 6:51PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain will continue in the Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 2 to 4 inches of rain is forecast before the rate rates ease late in the day. For the North West Region...including Mt. Vernon...Major flooding is forecast. For the South West Region...including Randle...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Chehalis River Basin Region...including Chehalis...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Mt. Vernon. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, the Skagit River will cause major flooding from Sedro Woolley downstream through Mount Vernon to the mouth. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many roads...farmlands and residential areas. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Skagit River Basin. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 2 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 35.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.5 feet on 11/04/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 445 PM PST.
